item.title: Report E-2024090509
item.description:
Report E-2024090509

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-25T09:22:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 13, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior, exterior, and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the trailer and on the pavement outside and swept them up with hand tools. Crews wiped down the impacted areas with absorbent pads, hand tools, and degrease. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Tthe damaged pails of paint were collected and containerized into one (1) other 55-gallon drum.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 13, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of GreenClean PRO was damaged by a forklift and released approximately four (4) pounds of product to the loading dock floor, shrink wrap, and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel collected the damaged bag of product, and impacted shrink wrap, for disposal. Crews utilized hand tools to collect the released material from the impacted areas. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly, vented drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: On September 11, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of ferric nitrate was damaged in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Clean Harbors (CH) to remediate the impacted site. CH personnel deployed granular absorbents and worked them in with hand tools. The crew then performed a gravity transfer into one (1) 75-gallon tote for continued shipment. All impacted material and PPE were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: On September 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1139 was damaged in transit due to unknown reasons and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and gravel beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. personnel deployed oil dry to the impacted area and worked it in with hand tools, a berm was put in place to prevent further migration of any material, during the duration of the continued to transport. All absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. On September 12, 2024, additional granular absorbents were deployed and they worked them in with hand tools. All remaining product was collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/9/24 rail car GIMX516236 arrived at the facility with 2 IBC containers that were found leaking material onto the rail car. Absorbent were put down and a crew was call out to address the release. The crew arrived and added containments pans under the area that was leaking and more absorbent was applied. The crew need more equipment and returned on 9/1/24 at 0900. They added more absorbents to the containers to absorb any free liquids that were left and addressed the container doors checking the seals and retightening them. The crew then cleaned the rail car and the outside of the boxes. They were completed and leaving the scene at 1630.

item.description:
Report X-2024091408

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-24T09:21:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/20/2024 at approximately 1011 Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 817392 at the staion location in Las Vegas, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of one plastic container packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered leaking from the bottom of the box. Further investigation revealed the plastic container contained iron, steel, nickel blackener and it spilled from the closure. An online safety data sheet classifed this commodity as UN3264 ; however, the shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the markings, labels, packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.description:
Report X-2024091409

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-24T09:21:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF states Regional Processing Specialist Elijah Sims was helping to unload trailer 85473 in dock door 43 when he saw a few 5 GAL pails of UN1760 Corrosive liquids, N.O.S, 8, PG I had leaked about 4 qt due to hanging off the pallet resulting in the fright to smash against the wall and bust open. ABF RPS stated that if they had loaded it correctly at the origin terminal, the freight wouldn't have rubbed up against the wall and spilled. ABF Safety advised RPS to block off the trailer until CURA has serviced it. CURA has been notified and dispatched to the terminal on emergency response. ABF advi sed RPS to send pictures to Safety.

  • City: LOS ANGELES

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 1st a package was found during the PM sort a package was found leaking. The package was opened and four cans of IPE Oil Deck Stain were found, with two of those cans leaking from the lids being opened. An SDS confirmed that this shipment is UN1263 Paint, 3, PGIII. There were no markings or indications on the outside of the package indicating that it contained and dangerous goods. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is being held pending disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024080719
item.description:
Report E-2024080719

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-24T09:21:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-26
  • City: NORTH CHARLESTON
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 08/26/2024, at 0820 hours, personnel in the CSXT Bennett Yard discovered GATX 6644, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, leaking from the top of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Southern States Chemical Inc, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-08-26-00040. HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found that the retainer cap, rupture disk and surge protector were missing from the safety vent of the tank car. Contractor personnel installed a surge protector, rupture disk and disc retainer, as well as decontaminated the top and sides of the rail car. The issue was identified, and corrective actions, were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Clay Hester, 912-944-7107). Emergency response efforts secured the car from leaking; it was held at location pending additional work by a certified tank car repair facility that could performed a qualified repaired.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer, material handler discovered a plastic drum that had fallen over due to improper preparation for transportation. Apparently, when the drum fell over a small crack developed on the bottom as a result of the drum getting pinched on the pallet it was staged on when it fell over that consequently contributed to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the cracked drum.

  • City: HOUSTON

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS FULLY MARKED AND LABELED AS DANGEROUS GOODS, UN1263 PAINT, WITH APPROPRIATE SHIPPING PAPERS. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FOUR X ONE GALLON PAINT CANS. THREE PAINT CANS ARE LEAKING FROM THEIR CLOSURE. ONE GALLON REMAINED INTACT. THE PACKAGE AND DANGEROUS GOODS CONTENTS HAVE BEEN DISPOSED OF PER NORMAL DANGEROUS GOODS DISPOSAL PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report E-2024090464
item.description:
Report E-2024090464

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: LITHONIA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On September 17, 2024, at 1141 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Lithonia, Georgia regarding the release of NALCO® BT-3011 BOILER WATER TREATMENT. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 260 gallons of Nalco BT-3011 Boiler Water Treatment (Sodium Hydroxide Solution, UN1824, 8, III) from (1) IBC plastic tote. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted the trailer floor, and multiple small areas of concrete as the trailer was in motion, that were unrecoverable. The residual material in the damaged tote was neutralized and solidified with absorbents, the damaged tote was cut up, then the trailer was neutralized and cleaned. Contractors also confirmed a 1ft x 6inch area of soil was impacted. Contractors were able to collect the impacted soil without complication. All waste was containerized in (4) 55-gallon DFs and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024091327
item.description:
Report X-2024091327

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: Bloomington
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Tank car CGTX 31178 was found in the West Colton Yard in Bloomington, CA with diesel down the sides of the tank car and between the manway and the combination housing. After assessment it was determined that the manway swing bolts were over tightened causing the manway to be misaligned, also, the safety eye bolt was offset/bowed from being over torqued causing product to release. The manway gasket was inspected, and no issues where found. The tank car manway was reset, and the swing bolts were secured properly. Contractor cleaned off all diesel impacted areas on the tank car.

item.title: Report E-2024090447
item.description:
Report E-2024090447

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-16
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 16, 2024, at 1055 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Los Angeles, California regarding the release of Methylene Chloride. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 30 gallons of Methylene Chloride (Dichloromethane, UN1593, 6.1, IIII) from (1) 55-gallon DM. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted a pallet and an area of the trailer floor. Contractors placed the damaged drum in an overpack and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM, and (1) 85-gallon plastic overpack, then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090443
item.description:
Report E-2024090443

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 13, 2024, at 1111 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Hebron, Ohio regarding the release of STRONTIUM CHROMATE 176. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1 pound of Strontium Chromate 176 (UN3077, 9, III) from (1) 1000 lb. supersack. The release was caused by a collapsed pallet and impacted a 1ft x 6ft area of the trailer floor. Contractors were able to successfully patch the hole in the punctured supersack then placed it in a lined gaylord. The release was collected with the proper PPE and placed in a metal drum. Another supersack that was undamaged but was on top of a collapsed pallet was also placed into a lined gaylord as a precaution. All cargo was unloaded, unwrapped, restacked and rewrapped onto new pallets before being reloaded onto the trailer. All waste was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DMs and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

ES&H personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged pail were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3066-impacted trailer. The damaged pail and all impacted waste was collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drums. Fifteen (15) additional pails were severely impacted and, per R+L, were palletized and gift wrapped. The waste drums and pallet of impacted pails were staged onsite for transport and disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 10, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of isopropyl alcohol was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. All spilled isopropyl alcohol had evaporated prior to the crew's arrival. One (1) 55-gallon metal drum of isopropyl alcohol was over packed for transport and disposal. Crews transported the over packed drum to the Newburgh (Montgomery) R+L Terminal

item.title: Report E-2024090432
item.description:
Report E-2024090432

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: SAINT ROBERTS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 10, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink was punctured in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior, under cage, and roadway beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the site. EWI Scraped the inside of the trailer using hand tools and degreaser. crews placed absorbents on the trailer floor to soak up all degreaser. The gravel underneath the trailer was shoveled using hand tools until no product was left on the ground. With approval from R+L the driver was sent to the St. Louis, MO, Terminals wash bay to remediate the exterior of the trailer. All spent absorbents, as well as any damaged drums were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum which was taken back to the Springfield, MO, R+L terminal where it was staged for future disposal

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 9, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1148 was punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services. LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel plugged the leaking drum and placed it into one 95-gallon overpack. Chem pads were placed to clean the bulk liquid and spill tackle was deployed to all affected areas. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were taken offsite for future disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN1133 UltraPly Bonding Adhesive release from a 5-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor and an 8’ x 2’ area of the concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged pail and cleanup debris were containerized into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 05:24 EST on 8/30, XPO-NBM contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 cup of UN1133 "WELD-ON 721" from a 1gallon metal pail impacting the dock floor. The pail was punctured by a forklift at NMP. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE. The damaged pail and clean up debris were containerized into a 20-gallon poly drum, which was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090446
item.description:
Report E-2024090446

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 17000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At 23:00 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NNA. It was reported that approximately 137.5 gallons of UN3266 Natural HDPE FCL13 released from a plastic tote due to a pole on another piece of freight puncturing the tote during the unloading process. The release impacted inside of trailer #3153521 and asphalt. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 180-gallons of product released to a 300-yard x 400-yard are of the asphalt lot as well as the trailer floor. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The remaining material in the tote was transferred into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized. All impacted absorbents and the cut up poly tote were then containerized into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090419
item.description:
Report E-2024090419

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 03:19 EST on 8/29, XPO-XSL contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 ounces of UN2078 "Solithane S 113" from a 1gal metal pail impacting the trailer floor. The pail was damaged during loading by XKC. ERTS confirmed the material to be hazard class 6.1. ERTS dispatched contractors for cleanup, however XPO terminal personnel decided to complete cleanup in house. Contractor response was canceled. XPO terminal personnel donned PPE and containerized the damaged pail and 3 other pails of the material into a 10-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090420
item.description:
Report E-2024090420

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: FRIDLEY
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1443ET, XPO notified ERTS of a pressurized canister hissing and frozen over on top at terminal XMP. It was reported that the hissing was consistent and getting heavier. ERTS advised we can send a contractor to check the valve, XPO moved trailer to the yard away from the dock, kept the trailer door opened and monitored the situation. The cylinder off-gassed and a contractor was not dispatched. No waste was generated.

item.title: Report X-2024091222
item.description:
Report X-2024091222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-25
  • City: MACON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8.25.24 E. Austin was notified of a potential release from UTLX 959328 inside Brosnan Yard. There was visible icing of the housing and a strong smell of Propane around the car. Appropriate PPE was donned, and the car was mounted. Once the housing was opened and Ice removed, it was determined that the Liquid Line Valve was open, and the Liquid Line Plug was loose. Both were tightened, effectively stopping the release. Pressure was measured at 175 PSI and there was 19in. of outage in the car.

item.title: Report E-2024090401
item.description:
Report E-2024090401

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-16
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At Veolia's ten-day facility in Henderson, CO, staff identified a leaking trailer in the parking lot storage area. Upon discovery, the trailer was promptly relocated to a loading dock for further inspection and handling. During the offloading process, it was determined that a drum within the trailer had sustained damage. Specifically, a nail puncture had created a pinhole leak at the bottom of the drum. As a result of this damage, approximately one gallon of liquid had escaped. Upon conducting a thorough investigation into the incident, the root cause of the leak was identified. It was discovered that the drum had been compromised due to a structural issue with its supporting pallet. Specifically, a nail was found to be protruding from the pallet on which the drum had been placed. This protruding nail had punctured the bottom of the drum during transit or handling, creating the pinhole leak that led to the subsequent fluid release. Immediate action was taken to address the situation. The compromised drum was placed into an overpack container to prevent any additional leakage. Concurrently, a thorough clean-up operation was conducted to remove all spilled liquid from the affected area, ensuring no residual contamination remained.

  • Description: A pallet of bags of UN3378 arrived damaged to service center 302. The service center manager advised that a pallet was jammed up into the bottom bag of the Pro, and when the pallet was removed it was discovered that it had punctured a bag on the bottom layer and torn a bag on the second layer. The p uncture to the bottom bag had left a small pile, but nothing seemed to have spilled from the bag with the tear above it. CURA was contacted for remediation.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/12/2024 at approximately 2315, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 749919 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 2 metal cans of paint packaged in one fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered displaying stains, prompting further investigation, which resulted in confirmation of spillage. One of the can showed evidence of paint spilling inside of the plastic closure. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and is being held, awaitng an amended Shipper' s Declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report E-2024090406
item.description:
Report E-2024090406

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: WESTLAND
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: An spill occurred at Veolia's ten-day transit facility located in Westland, MI during a routine drum transfer operation. An employee was using a drum picker to load a drum onto a trailer when the situation occurred. As the drum was being maneuvered into position, it inadvertently made contact with the side of the trailer. Upon impact, it was discovered that a sharp piece of metal protruding from the trailer's side had punctured the drum, resulting in a dime-sized hole. The employee immediately noticed the damage and the subsequent leak. It was estimated that approximately two gallons of the drum's contents had spilled as a result of the puncture.

item.description:
Report E-2024090407

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: SANTA ROSA BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 9, 2024, five (5) five-gallon pails of primer were dropped during unloading and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of primer to the asphalt. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from NRC Gulf Environmental Services, Inc. (NRC Gulf) to remediate the impacted site. NRC Gulf placed all damaged pails into seven (7) lined 55-gallon drums. Granular absorbents were placed onto all primer impacted areas. The crew swept up all loose absorbents with hand tools. A pressure washing system was used on all stained concrete and a vac truck was utilized to retain any loose water. All seven (7) waste drums were taken offsite and staged at the Milton, Florida R+L terminal. All waste water was taken with the crew to be disposed of on a later date.

  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 9, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2265 was shipped with faulty packaging and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the dock floor and pallet below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized absorbents to remediate the dock floor and impacted pallet. Crews collected the 55-gallon drum into one (1) 95-gallon drum. All spent absorbent media were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for CES processing.

item.title: Report E-2024090414
item.description:
Report E-2024090414

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: AKRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 9, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of organic peroxide had a damaged cap and released approximately two (2) ounces to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed absorbent rags to the impacted drum, and neutralized the exterior. A replacement cap was then used to fix the drum. The drum was staged on the truck for future shipping. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon vented drum and was taken to the Columbiana terminal for future disposal.

  • Description: A return, Generator with gas still in tank, was sent through the system in an unmarked U-Haul box. Package was placed on van line and went overhead. Damage occurred by simulator at Load-side 135. The package showed no external indications of gasoline, including smell, prior to spill. An employee handling the package after the spill, accidently rubbed their eye. The eye wash station was used before leaving for the emergency room. Chemical spill occurred inside trailer as well, number of packages affected unknown. Neutralizer used on the spill.

  • Description: At 1204 ET, XPO terminal UMV notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1-Quart of Premier 6 PH-18 HS Urethane Activator medium released due to unknown reasons. The release impacted trailer #3178599. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used oil dri to absorb the spill and a 5-Gallon metal drum for the waste. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN

  • Carrier/Reporter: US ECOLOGY TRANSPORTATION SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The bottle of nitric acid was packed in accordance with lab pack standards and shipped to the 10-day transfer facility in Indianapolis. The package was transferred onto an on-site trailer at the facility and placed on top of a 5-gallon pail unsecured. When the trailer was subsequently moved into the dock, the lab pack box fell 18 inches and approximately 1/2 quart of nitric acid leaked from the package. The original container and the clean up residue were overpacked in a 15-gallon poly drum with vermiculite. The containers were not fully blocked and braced since the trailer was not leaving the site.

  • Description: Driver was unloading Sulfuric at GlobITech Sherman TX dry mate broke on the fill line to tank as the driver was offloading sulfuric acid. There was a 200ft hose and Globitech employee assisting with transfer. The PVC line broke spilling<10 gallons of material into containment. The material splashed on the Globitech employee burning him on his back. He was rinsed in the EW.SS and went to the hospital. He was released the same day and made a full recovery.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-21T00:40:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: MCRAE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 45
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Car was found releasing vapor as it went through Beebe, AR and was stopped by the local FD outside McRae, AR. The FD conducted a 1/2-mile evacuation and isolated the area. Upon HMM arrival, we met with the FD and was granted approval to access the car. Upon inspection of the car, liquid was observed releasing from under the valve at the connection of the 4-bolt valve flange to the flanged riser due to all four nuts that secure the valve to the flange not secured. The four nuts were found inside the protective housing. The pressure was removed from the car, the leak stopped, and the four bolts properly secured. The car was neutralized and set out. An OTMA-1 was granted for movement back to the shipper.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LEP experienced a UN1866 Bulldog Adhesion Promoter release from 2 boxes each containing (6) 1-quart metal bottles. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6 quarts of product released to a 3’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor and a 3’ x 4’ area of the concrete lot below. The cans were damaged as a result of being crushed due to stacking/improper loading. The (8) damaged cans were placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. All impacted cardboard, pads, and absorbents used to clean the spill were placed into a second 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090347
item.description:
Report E-2024090347

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured bottle of hazardous product, Instant Power® Heavy Duty Drain Opener. The plastic bottle was punctured by a forklift blade that resulted in the release of approximately 1-gallon of product onto the pallet and wooden trailer floor in an 8’x2’ area. A Contractor neutralized the release using KolorSafe Liquid Neutralizer and applied oil dry. The neutralized impacted pallet was cut-up and containerized into a 95-gallon DF. The neutralized impacted absorbents, PPE, and product were containerized into a 55-gallon DF. XPO will manage the waste until end disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.description:
Report X-2024091064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: TYLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: There were 8 boxes in the shipment each containing 4 cans. One of the boxes appears to have been crushed by freight in transit before arriving to service center 177, but the damage went unnoticed to the customer facility. The customer refused 5 of the 8 boxes due to the damaged can leaking onto the other boxes. It was then noticed that service center 070 noted that the shipment was damaged but did not note the type of damage and sent it on to 177. CURA was contacted for remediation.

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: FLINT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/12/2024 at approximately 1830, Dangerous Goods Administration was notified that a package, classified as UN 3373, shipping under Tracking # 777754911170 was discovered leaking at the ramp facility in Flint, MI. The package was discovered in a documents bag, displaying dampness. The eOps report indicates that the shipment was originally retrieved from a local drop box; however, the cause of the spillage cannot be confirmed. No other packages were affected, as the spillage appeared to be contained inside the documents bag. The spilled package was placed is a salvage drum for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090369
item.description:
Report E-2024090369

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 6, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of Swisher Hercules was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the Swisher Hercules-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. Crews neutralized the absorbents and spilled materials and utilized pH test strips. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and one (1) damaged pail of Swisher Hercules was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: At 1236 ET, XPO-UMM notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of UN3077 Curene 442 released from a 30 gallon metal drum due to a forklift accident. The release impacted inside trailer#315-2615. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Terminal cleaned the trailer with absorbents. The damaged drum and all impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO called in to report a 5-gallon spill of UN1263 "DURANAR BONE WHITE" from a 55-gallon metal drum caused by what appears to be improper loading which resulted in a dent toward the bottom of the drum. The spill has impacted the trailer floor and the asphalt of Pilot Travel Center. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed 3-gallons of UN1263 "DURANAR BONE WHITE" product released to 3'x3' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. Contractors deployed absorbents to the impacted area. The damaged drum was overpacked into a 95-gallon poly waste drum. All impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was transported to the XPO terminal located in Amarillo, TX for terminal personnel to manage. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1837 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at NKX. It was reported that approximately 10 gallons of UN2491 Pre Tect 7080 HP released from 330-gallon metal tote. The valve at the top of the tote was broken off and is missing. The release impacted the floor of trailer #3110252 and the concrete underneath at Dock Door 78. ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived on site, neutralized the area, deployed absorbents, and cleaned up the released material from 2'x23' trailer and 2'x10 concrete with impacted acid pads and Sodium Baicarb. Product was transloaded to new metal tote. Damaged tote and drum were staged onsite at the terminal for personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 1633 ET, XPO terminal UAQ notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 2-Gallons of Echo Red Armor Fuel UN1203 released from several 3.25-liter metal pails due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer #3191655. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Upon the contractor's arrival, personnel observed the released material impacted 4'x4' area of the wooden pallet due to improper loading. Contractors overpacked 95-gallon drum, and recovered material was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
